programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Corey has an appetite for a deal when a Guns N Roses collector box rocks into the shop. But will Corey end up in Paradise City, or out in the cold November rain?

programme.title: Secrets Declassified With David Duchovny
programme.desc: New files reveal NASA’s moon nuke plan, a Soviet space disaster cover-up, and spy missions that launched the secret space race.

programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Many mysteries of planet Earth are far from understood. How was Devils Tower formed? Or why do some people get struck by lightning multiple times? While some may write off these as random occurrences, might they instead point to a new understanding?

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Farmer Fuddles chickens have escaped. Their feathers make Vivienne Volcano very itchy. Messy has to find a way to scratch her itches and round up the chickens!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Blueberry and Huckleberry pitch their new play, an adaptation of the Baby Berrykins’ favorite BerryFairyTale, “The Littlest Berrykin,” to Plum and the assembled cast and crew. We see the story they are narrating in action: a comedy about three princesses (played by Strawberry, Lemon and Raspberry) on a quest for a fabled Golden Berry to determine which of them is best suited to rule the kingdom—the King and Queen (Huck and Blueberry) are retiring to the tropics. Accompanied by their Berrykins-in-Waiting, the Princesses set off on the quest. Whichever one returns with the Golden Berry will be declared the new monarch.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry finds a skipping rope outside his house and decides that Finders should be Keepers, so he goes to Dino World to play with it.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is nervous about giving a speech about dinosaurs to his classmates.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers go to the rainforest to find a new home for a goliath birdeater spider. But can the Junior Rangers scare off a pair of weasels who are preying on their eight-legged friend?

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Judy and Jerome, the breakdown train, have been stuck at Knapford Yard for some time – having been somewhat superseded by Rocky and even Harvey. Ryan hears their sad story and offers to take them to Arelsburgh Harbour for a change of scenery. They love it there at first but soon take advantage of other engines so they can have a tour around the island. Meanwhile, Daisy has a run in with a bull and is derailed. When Thomas goes looking for the breakdown train, it is nowhere to be found! Ryan feels responsible – not just for Daisy but also to make sure Judy And Jerome get to be Really Useful. Ryan catches up with Judy and Jerome in the end and The Fat Controller is reminded how useful they can be. He decides they will have a new home at Arlesburgh with their friends Ryan and Daisy.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Daisy the railcar can carry passengers without having to pull any coaches. So, when Thomas is sent to work in the quarry for a spell and Daisy takes on his usual responsibilities, Annie and Clarabel are left behind. Daisy takes every opportunity to remind Annie and Clarabel that, as long as she is working Thomas’s branch line, they are not needed. But, when Daisy becomes popular with her passengers, she has to pull some passenger coaches after all! Annie and Clarabel get their own back by tricking Daisy into thinking she is need of repair. But two wrongs don’t make a right and Annie and Clarabel only end up being left behind in a siding… and then pulled along by dirty old Diesel! *Cough! Cough!*

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Gertrud promised Maria to make a perfume for Toramento with whom she has a first date tonight. Unfortunately, Gertruds laboratory has burned down and with it, all the ingredients. Grisus mission (with Stella’s help) is to find the flowers the perfume requires and to help Gertrud to make the perfume again. But finding the flowers is not an easy thing, especially with Thingy around. Moreover, Grisu, peeved by Fume, spits a flame, and burns all the ingredients once more! But Grisu is a resourceful dragon, and he manages to create the perfume Maria expects just in time for her romantic date!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Grisu helps Professor Smeraldo to retrieve a Dragonosarus egg from the icecap. Fume joins the mission too, hoping to do some dragon training. They must prevent the prehistoric egg, caught in an iceblock, from falling off a crevasse, but a hungry albatross pops out and the mission is not so easy since the ice block ends up falling into the crevasse. Luckily, snowdrift softers the impact but our heroes find themselves without any rope to bring the egg back. In the end, the little dragon creates an ice firefighter pole using Smeraldos searching material and manages the rescue the egg with Fumè’s help.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Big Nutbrown Hare tells Little Nutbrown Hare a beautiful full moon will rise that night, Little Nutbrown wants to invite all his friends around for a celebration. When the full moon is veiled in clouds, Little Nutbrown is disappointed - but is extra delighted when the clouds part to reveal a bright red moon.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a Midsummers night, Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends decide to try to stay up all night. With the beautiful long dusk there is plenty of time for play, but one by one they drop off to sleep in the wee small hours. Luckily that leaves them plenty of energy to play the next day.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: The parents leave for an adventure and the children decide to have some big adventures too. For Scoutbadger and Rosie this means going far from the burrow while for Woodsy it means building some wings so that he can fly. But perhaps these big dreams are just a little too big ?

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Mr Bentley is doing vocal warm-ups with the Spring City Rockets, and is about to begin rehearsals for his latest masterpiece, “A Pocketful of Pirates”. As Bob, Wendy, Leo, Dizzy and Muck arrive to renovate the hilltop theatre, Mr Bentley encourages them to join in the warm-ups. But Bob proves to be a hopeless thespian. As he confesses: I’m a builder, not a actor!” But Dizzy shows theatrical flair. When Mr Bentley has to run home and retrieve an important prop, he asks Dizzy to assistant direct. She’s so excited by the task that she accidentally tells Leo to use slow-drying cement instead of fast-drying cement as they begin paving a hillside track down to the theatre. Torn between two important tasks - the play and the build - Dizzy also messes up her directorial duties, telling Brandon to get his pirate props from the wrong box.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Team Bob are on site to create a temporary city beach for the summer in Spring City. Bob explains that they will be using sand from a real beach. Mr. Bentley interrupts to inform them that he wants it to be a ‘Blue Ribbon’ beach, an eco award for the cleanest, safest beaches, so they will have to work hard to keep the site tidy. There will be an inspection later in the day and he is determined for them to get the award for Spring City. Lofty takes this very seriously and is worried when Muck spills sand on the site.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids try to find the owner of a camera using the photos for clues. All the pictures are sporting events, so they eventually find out the camera belongs to the sports reporter for the Busytown Bugle./ A list Sally made mysteriously disappears right off the page.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo catches a raccoon digging around in his trash. The Junior Rangers take the raccoon back to the forest where it can find its own food. However, some unfriendly raccoons make things difficult for Leo and company...

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A yellow-eyed penguin wanders into Hero’s kennel. The Junior Rangers head to New Zealand to find the penguin’s home, but can they prevent tourists from disturbing yellow-eyed penguins on the beach?

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon wants to beat his record for juggling the soccer ball with his foot. Not easy with Gaspard who is always there, under foot! Boy, he’s just like sticky glue! Ah, Gaspard has to go to a birthday party and Simon breathes a huge sigh of relief. Whew, finally alone! Simon beats his juggling record but there’s no one around to see! Daddy is busy in the work shed and Mommy is on the phone with a colleague. Simon starts wishing that Gaspard were around! Boy does he ever miss him! And he starts counting the minutes until his little brother, “Mister Sticky Glue” gets back from his birthday party!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Stanleys birthday is approaching, and he becomes very curious and can’t wait to find out what gift he will receive from Dolly. He peeks into the ladybird girls drawer. The next day, he tells Balthazar that he knows what his gift will be. On his birthday, the friends gather and wish Stanley a happy birthday. Flutter presents the cake, they sing, and then Stanley blows out the candles and cuts the cake. Stanley receives many nice gifts, including a bowling set from Dolly. Stanley admits that he peeked into the ladybird girls drawer because he was curious about his gift.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Shaun invites his friends to Sand Island during the summer heatwave. Christopher and Chloe, the two canaries, ferry the friends over. Bubble, Balthazar, Dolly, Stanley, Berry, Flutter, and Shaun build sand houses. Balthazar accidentally knocks down Bubble the flower beetles house. Suddenly, a summer shower begins and washes away all the sand houses. They stand sadly around their ruined creations and decide to build a large drip sandcastle together. Side by side, they build drip towers, construct castle walls, and decorate the tops with sand balls. The day passes joyfully, and by the evening, when the canaries come to pick them up, magnificent drip towers stand tall on the island.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: At the end of summer, the Star Girl visits her friends. She rarely comes because her star-shaped house is in the sky. They spend a day together, and when night falls, the Star Girl bids everyone farewell. She can’t speak, but she plays the harp beautifully. The music will lift her house into the sky. However, this time one of the harp strings comes loose, and the house doesn’t rise. The Wind blows the string out of her hand, and she can’t catch it.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The Centipedes apple tree hasn’t had any fruit for many years. He asks Berry for help, who carefully tends to the tree. At the beginning of summer, apples finally appear, and the Centipede is so happy that he invites his distant relative, the Millipede, for a visit. However, the Millipede falls ill and can’t come. The Centipede then invites his friends to a big apple party. When they arrive, they pretend that the Millipede was there, but it turns out that it was just his friends in costume.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The Cave Spider and the tiny Spiderling are good friends, and one summer day they are walking on the mountaintop. Spiderling blows a dandelion at the Cave Spider, who falls and gets injured. Spiderling immediately seeks help from Doctor Owl, who determines that the Cave Spiders legs are bruised and prescribes two weeks of rest. Berry, Dolly, Stanley, and Balthazar help the Cave Spider get home. Dolly suggests they sew a large canopy so the Cave Spider can watch the ants end-of-summer fireworks from the air. Flutter, Leapy, Zephyr, and the others make the canopy, and on the night of the fireworks, they lift the Cave Spider up so he can enjoy the view from above.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a spring day, Alfonso finds an unknown seedling by the stream. The cricket carefully guards the plant, which soon produces a special flower. Alfonso waters and tends to it daily, happily watching it grow. One morning at the end of summer, Alfonso notices that the flower has wilted and its petals have fallen off. Sadly, he gathers the petals and brings them into the house. In the afternoon, Dolly visits him, and later his friends come over to cheer him up. They bring delicious pancakes, but Alfonso is still sad. They go out to the stream, and Alfonso scatters the flower petals into the water, bidding them farewell with tears.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: As the end of summer approaches, the Lightning Beetle visits the fireflies and surprises them with a new book about planets and stars. After a conversation, one little firefly, when the others were already asleep, sets out to conquer the sky, but becomes completely exhausted and crashes. Doctor Owl diagnoses him with a fever and possible pneumonia, so he stays with him to heal. The other fireflies decide to surprise him. With the help of Berry, Dolly, Balthazar, Stanley, Flutter, and Eddy, they make colourful orbs, and the Lightning Beetle crafts the Sun. They suspend the planets on a hoop, which Eddy rotates with a contraption. They also instal tiny lights, resembling stars.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants Flop to read him a story when he has his bath but gets sad when his book gets wet. Flop helps him to understand that even though the book is wet, the story isnt.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing has a great time choosing the perfect present for Sula in Padgets shop. Its a wand and is sparkly and flashy and spinny and Bing knows that she will love it. Bing is thrilled until it is time to hand the present over.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to try Coco’s Hula Hoop. It’s harder than it looks but he finds lots of other hoopy games as he tries. Just as Bing almost gets it right he gets carried away with spinning, trips over and breaks the hoop. Coco is upset that she can’t hula anymore until Bing and Charlie remind her of all the other games they can still do with the bent hoop.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are in the park playing at being giants and splashing in puddles with their big welly boots. As they play the puddles get bigger and bigger until Bing slips over in the mud and gets wet everywhere. Amma comes to the rescue with a giant warm bath and a giant carroty bagel.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: New guests arrive at Guesthouse Appleseed – the famous band “The Merry Mice” and two hares who want to record birds singing. But with the mice practising their music, the hares can’t hear any birds.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda asks Edna to repair her entrance door that creaks so loudly that her guests want to leave Guesthouse Appleseed. But normally, Rupert does all repairing work for Tilda and interferes.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: It’s time for spring-cleaning and Tilda decides to give her friends all the things that she doesn’t need any more and brings them in her garden. But her friends now think she’s moving out.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a snowy Winter’s morning Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are amazed at the intricate patterns they find in the snowflakes, each one different from the others. The friends try to take one to show Big Nutbrown Hare, but they always melt before he sees them. Will they find a way to stop the lovely flakes from melting?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare discovers that he has grown a thick Winter coat, he and Little Field Mouse make a coat from moss to help other creatures in the meadow stay warm. They discover that everyone has their own ways of coping in the colder months, but Big Nutbrown Hare uses the coat as a picnic rug on the snow so they can enjoy a Winter feast.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is fascinated that his friend Little Grey Squirrel is going to stay in his dray all Winter long. He and Little Field Mouse decide to hibernate in the hollow log until Spring, but soon become bored and fidgety. Little Field Mouse gives up and plays in the snow. Will Little Nutbrown Hare manage to stay inside, or will he be tempted out as well?

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Koko and Brewster are trying for their Courier badges. They each have to deliver three packages before five o’clock. But after two deliveries, Koko’s badge quest is interrupted when Eddie needs her to take him to an emergency track repair. Koko thinks she hasn’t won her badge – until Vee says that, as Koko has ‘delivered’ him to the track repair, Eddie can count as the third package

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Zari is skating her way through the park in an urgent hurry to find a bathroom. She finally spots a public toilet and dashes in. After she finished her business, she encounter a green peacock with its tail feathers open, admiring itself in the mirror. The creature is blocking the way out of the toilet. Back in the garden. Leo and Katie are playing with a large hand mirror where Leo draws on it to make the the person seeing themselves to have bunny whiskers. They play around with Hero, their dog. Then Leo receives a call from Zari, informing of her being trapped by the green peacock. After learning more information on the animal back in their treehouse, the Junior Rangers agree in helping Zari escapes there by travelling to save her. Once they arrive, Leo has an idea of using the large hand mirror to bait the peacock out of the public toilet. His plan work, but now the peacock is attempting to chases him over. Leo evades the animals pounce when Ranger Rocky grab him above to saves him.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kyle arrives at the beach on his ATV only to be disappointed by the sight of scattered trash. Reluctantly, he cleans up the mess while venting his frustration at the unknown culprit. As he heads back to his ATV, he encounters a curious raccoon but fails to get close to it as it scampers away at the sound of the trash bag. Curiosity gets the better of Kyle, leading him to investigate underneath his ATV. To his surprise, he discovers a partially buried nest of eggs. Meanwhile, in the garden, Leo and Katie prepare a bath for their beloved dog Hero. Much to their astonishment, Hero returns with a duckling in tow, leaving everyone perplexed. The duckling jumps into the bath, enjoying itself, and Hero finds himself torn between joining in or not. Amidst the confusion, Leo receives a call from Kyle, who informs him about the raccoon that laid the eggs. Skeptical at first, the Junior Rangers decide to gather more information using Katies computer. Convinced of the situations authenticity, they agree to meet up with Kyle to help him move his stuck ATV without disturbing the eggs. They strategize and come up with a plan to lift the ATV using it like a helicopter. Their efforts pay off, but as the eggs start to hatch, they notice the baby turtles heading in the wrong direction away from the ocean. Kyle attempts to intervene but is stopped by the arrival of Ranger Rocky, who emerges from the sea.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi loves picking vegetables in the vegetable garden! But when Mom asks him if he remembered to water the tomato plants, as per her request this morning, he freaks out: he was too busy having fun and forgot! In a mad rush, he gets Nina to help him find a way to keep Mom busy while he quickly waters the tomatoes. But it just doesn’t seem to work: the plants look positively sick!... But, what if there’s another way to tend to vegetables…?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When Fred gives his daughter Nina a little badge, officially recognizing her as a "farmer,"Tchoupi gets envious: he wants a "farmer badge" too! Nina warns him: it’s not that easy, but Tchoupi believes he can do it and begins learning the ropes in earnest, following his friend’s instructions. He does pretty well with it… until the greedy goat escapes from her pen and makes a beeline for the large vegetable garden! Poor Tchoupi: doesn’t look like he’ll be getting that badge any time soon…!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are super excited about going running in the woods! But they must wait for Fanni to wake up from her nap before heading out… When the nap drags on, the parents suggest they take Fanni to the forest in her stroller so that she can continue to sleep. However, this means everyone must remain silent during the excursion so as not to wake the baby: Shhhhhh!... Luckily, it ends up being a great opportunity to discover all the amazing sounds the forest has to offer!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Shelley has brought little caterpillars to class and each pupil will take one home with them and care for it until it turns into a butterfly. But Paulie and Ben hope to speed up the process by feeding their caterpillars candy!! Charlie, on the other hand, has chosen to double the dose of blackberry leaves… who will be the first to have a butterfly?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia were supposed to attend a cartoon screening at the theater, but Sam has to babysit the triplets. Is there a way to keep an eye on them and still go to watch the movie?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: As a young fisherman, GrandPa was thanked by a king for having saved him from the pirates. The monarch offered him two large rubies that he hid in the residence. Can Sam and Julia find them?

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas loses his voice trying to sing opera like his Italian friends, and tries to find a new way to pass on a very important message

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: One day while levelling the site for Wellsworth Hospital’s new parking lot/car park, Brenda finds that someone had dumped a large mound of stone right in her cleaned-up work site. She thinks Monty and Max are responsible and so she clears the stone away. Little did she know that it was the stone for filling in the hospital’s extension foundations Jack and Alfie have just dug out. They wonder what became of the stone when they arrive to collect it. Miss Jenny asks for Nia to bring more stone from the quarry but even that load goes missing, not long after Jack unloads it. Where could it have gone to? Everyone soon finds the answer and the outcome is also quite convenient for both the pack and Brenda.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: When Caillous Scout Troop arrive for their first outdoor adventure, he finds himself a little worried of spending the night in a tent, because he is afraid of the dark! However, he soon learns that Clementine is also scared - of bugs! Everyone is afraid of something, and together they just might find a way to conquer both their fears.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: After ignoring Daddys words of caution, Caillou climbs a tree,breaking a branch and unknowingly hurting Gilbert. Caillou learnsto be more considerate of others needs as he helps nurse Gilbertback to full health.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When a new nameplate is about to be placed on the statue of Admiral Hornblast, it suddenly disappears. Huckle, Sally and Lowly check out the photos and videos taken at the scene and ultimately determine that the statue slide over the plate when it was bumped by an out of control bulldozer./Pig Will and Pig Won’t are playing spies. However Pig Won’t suddenly finds himself out of the game when his Secret Spy Ring disappears!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey cant seem to slow down. Mole then appears and tells them about the snail who is known for being very slow. Parrot immediately suggests they go to the Meadow. They come across a snail shell which Monkey at first mistakes for a pebble and want to throw into the water, luckily the snail stops him. Soon they are all playing a slow-mo version of Monkey See Monkey Do.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Trevor leads a group hike to the beaver dam and Pontypandy Mountain, but without using a compass or a map either.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Trevor leads a group hike to the beaver dam and Pontypandy Mountain, but without using a compass and soon without a map, either!

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: The Super Cluepers try to find a bunch of carrots that have gone mysteriously missing from the Rabbit family garden. But they finally realize that taking your time to think things through one step at a time is more fruitful than going for the easy answer. They even find the missing carrots – in a freshly baked carrot cake they are all invited to enjoy! /Its better to tell the truth even if its hard to say. Franklin pretends to like pickles to spare Beaver’s feelings, but she gets the wrong idea and thinks he loves them. It’s only when the dreaded pickles start to get in the way of his and Beaver’s friendship that Franklin realizes he has to fess up.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: The Tomcats now consider Rosie as their "enemy number 1" instead of Scoutbadger. Blinded by rivalry, Scoutbadger is fooled by the cats who turn him against the fox so that they can steal a game of skittles. Our two heroes will finally join together to get back the skittles, especially as these belong to Woodsy…

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky would like to discover the secrets and hidden treasures of Mother Nature. But it is not the spider who weaves its web that can accompany him! Doodleboo has a Riddleboo that will do the trick...

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: 1 ride, 2 rides, 3 rides.... 10 rides! In the competition of going around in circles, Sketcky gets dizzy quickly! Doodleboo knows a Riddleboo that is as pretty as Bubble!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: What can help Sketchy to become a sledding champion? Doodleboo explains how to draw a penguin.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave befriend a little lost bug called Buddy, and take him back to his jungle home. They know that Buddy Bug will be safe and snug when they find his home, so they search for bugs that look just like Buddy and make sure he is reunited with his family.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave put on a magic show for their friends. They choose cool magician names and Hatty teaches them the ‘trick’ behind three special magic tricks. Dave, the Marvellous Mysterioso makes a banana magically disappear, The Terrific Tweeto moves a pencil without touching it and Ruff-Ruff, the Great Barko Bongo amazes everyone by making some froggy-friends magically appear from Hatty’s hat!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare discovers he cant fit under his favourite hiding log anymore. With Big Nutbrown Hares help, he learns he has grown bigger since last Spring, and can now clamber into a hole in a tree thats an even better hiding place. Big Nutbrown Hare learns that you are never too young to play.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Big Nutbrown Hare tells Little Nutbrown Hare a beautiful full moon will rise that night, Little Nutbrown wants to invite all his friends around for a celebration. When the full moon is veiled in clouds, Little Nutbrown is disappointed - but is extra delighted when the clouds part to reveal a bright red moon.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a Midsummers night, Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends decide to try to stay up all night. With the beautiful long dusk there is plenty of time for play, but one by one they drop off to sleep in the wee small hours. Luckily that leaves them plenty of energy to play the next day.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Pando and me did music all together.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are playing a vooshing game with their favourite toys, Hoppity Voosh and Hippo Fairy. They throw them into the air to see how high they can fly – Voooooosh! Uh-oh…Sula’s hippo gets stuck in a tree so Bing throws Hoppity up to save her, only for Hoppity to get stuck too.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando are playing outside in the cold, blowing steamy dragon breath at each other and discovering icicles hanging from the tap. Flop makes hot chocolate to warm everybody up but Bing can’t wait for it to cool down before he can drink it and burns his fingers – Pando’s quick thinking brings the icicle to the rescue.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Charlie is coming to play and Bing has planned lots of things for them to do. But when Charlie arrives he doesn’t want to play any of the games Bing has put out. Bing is upset until Flop suggests they watch to see what Charlie really wants to do. Charlie heads straight for the kitchen where he, and Bing, have a great time making music with pots and pans.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop see Pando skateboarding and Bing wants a go but its a lot harder than it looks and Bing falls off. Pando finds a clever way to help Bing get his confidence back.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Balthazar and Stanley are building a raft that gets carried away by the stream. They end up far from home, but then decide to head back during a storm. Christopher, the canary helps them, but they fall off during a gust of wind. They find refuge in a hollow to rest where they are finally discovered and helped to go home by the Spider. The next day, they play along the stream again, but they no longer worry if the raft run away.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Flutter, the butterfly girl, tries to bake an apple pie, but unfortunately, it doesnt turn out well. With the help of a fairy, she manages to fix it and then finds a lost marker and repairs the window as well. The Lily Fairy discovers that Flutter solved everything on her own and then moves on to help others.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, invites Bubble, Berry, and Dolly for a visit. They make ice cream and play together. Bubble admits to cheating in the game. Because of this, the little friends come up with a new game where everyone can win."

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the forest gather on the hilltop to watch the evening meteor shower. Stanley and Balthazar want to build a seesaw but constantly encounter obstacles. The Firefly helps them, and with the assistance of the Moon, they swing on the Moon rocker seesaw. The meteor shower mesmerizes them, then they bid farewell to each other, and everyone starts heading home. The Firefly falls asleep contentedly.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Mr. Rabbit makes up coupons for free cookies to celebrate the grand opening of his cookie shop and gives them to his young son to drop in the mailbox outside. But the coupons never arrive. After chasing down the clues from the mail carrier to the post office and back again, Huckle determines that Jr Rabbit mistakenly dropped the coupons into the trash container beside the mail box. /A model boat is mysteriously broken and Huckle, Lowly and Sally set out to discover how it happened.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey and Parrot are rehearsing for a talent show... a synchronized dance number... but of course they are anything but... Mole then appears and tells them of how Swans are known for their graceful couples dance. They decide to go to the lake and learn from the masters. When they arrive they are dazzled by swans dual dance and invite them to play Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Its the Pontypandy Animal Parade at Annies Farm, and Peter and Norman want to join in by rounding Lambikins and Woolly.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: For Norman’s new webcast, Hannah and Norman try to get Joe to do silly things on camera, but they’re foiled by Miss Pawdry every time!

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper finds Tiger messily trying to make a clay pot on his new potter’s wheel. They decide to make some pots together and Tiger tells Kipper how difficult it is. Pig gives Arnold a ride on the potter’s wheels thinking it is a car without wheels. They find the pots Tiger and Kipper have been making and think they’re chocolate cookies. Tiger has some explaining to do.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper hears a rustling noise in the park. It’s Tiger looking for the Park Monster. Kipper says there aren’t any monsters in the park but Tiger says it is just a game. Then they see something large and shadowy in the grass… they set a trap for it using sweets but it turns out the monster is someone they know quite well.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: After having to stay indoors during a summer shower, Tchoupi and Nina are happy to be able to go back outside and play. Naturally, with rain comes snails. But unfortunately, T’choupi accidentally drops one, denting its shell. There’s no way he’s going to just walk away and leave it to its fate! So Dad advises the kids on how to take care of the gastropod… not an easy feat, when all it wants to do is run away...!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are playing in the cottage when a big "boom" startles them. Running out onto the terrace, they find a stunned sparrow: it’s obvious the small bird flew into the window and has gotten a big bump from the collision! Dad insists the animal needs peace and quiet in order to recover. T’choupi and Nina set themselves the mission of tending to the wounded bird. But disruptions in the cottage, such as a fleeing goat and a chasing cat, make their task way more difficult than expected! Will T’choupi and Nina manage to help the sparrow fly again?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia has caught mousie pox. Doctor Spotty is sorry but she is not allowed to see Sam anymore for a few days, and get bored alone in her room. How can she play with her friend without disobey?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam has agreed to water Mr. Grumpys flowers. When they enters Mr. Grumpys empty apartment, Sam and Julia discover that Mr. Grumpy has some hidden reasons for being so withdrawn...

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda launches an herbal delivery service, and demand is huge. But Billy and Benny mix up orders: now Rupert cant sleep, and Robin sleeps through his morning song. Tilda must fix the chaos.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: When the Triplets are going to the beach, Turbulent offers to carry the umbrella but it seems too heavy for him and Mommy asks him if he wants help. But no ! « I am strong » answers Turbulent. Then comes the lifeguard to help them, he is super strong with giant muscles and Turbulent is very impressed. Plus, the lifeguard has won the "Mister Beach" competition. It’s decided, Turbulent will do exactly the same. He decides to start exercising, doing a lot of push ups and weightlifting. But sport is really hard. And Turbulent would rather play with his brother and sister.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets are having fun in the park with Toto when the dog suddenly rushes after Mrs Gzells cat, well actually rather after the cookie the cat had in its mouth. He runs like the wind and for the Triplets, Toto is THE Champion. But Mrs Gzell replies that if he’s so strong like they say, he should take part to the dog championship the next day. The Triplets are sure Toto will win everything, the competition of snoring, of barking and even the eating contest. Unfortunately, when the competition begins, those are not the challenges the Triplets were expecting.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Edmond lives happily with his three little badger cubs in their underground sett. One day, he falls in love with Marguerite, a fox! Marguerite and her daughter move into the family home, turning life upside-down for everyone, who now needs to find a new way to live together in harmony.Directed by: Florian Ferrier (France, 2018)

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and Daddy play a VR video game in an arcade, as Caillou tries to win a Robot toy.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and his friends all try and stay awake until midnight on New Year’s Eve.

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: Phillip, the little diesel boxcab, arrives at Knapford full of energy and enthusiasm. When Gordon tells Phillip how fast he is, Phillip is determined to prove that he is faster and challenges him to a race. Unfortunately Gordon is resting on the siding when Phillip comes over and when the express engine tells Phillip to “go away”, he thinks it’s a challenge and races off. When he gets to the other end of the line and Gordon still hasn’t overtaken him, Phillip assumes he’s won, causing Gordon to show him just how fast he really can be. Phillip is very impressed, but he is not in the least disheartened as he believes he still beat Gordon the first time.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: It’s a busy day at Chug Patrol Headquarters: Jackman attends to a spilled load and firechugger Asher deals with a trackside fire. As Calley watches Jackman in action with his crane and Asher with his fire hose, she worries that she doesn’t have a specialty of her own. Then, when a mix up leaves an emergency situation unattended, Jackman decides that Chug Patrol needs a first responder to be the first to report to an emergency scene. Calley and Asher compete for the job. At the Chug-a-sonic Speedtrack, Jackman tests them on their speed and knowledge. In the end it is clear that Calley has a vast understanding of emergency situations and lots of experience dealing with them. To her delight, she gets the job, along with her own specialty!

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: The chuggineers are pulling up track at the old power station. Zack allows Brewster to take the old track pieces away to practise his track laying skills. Wilson is struggling to get the hang of his net-shooting car, so he tags along. Brewster and Wilson are practising near the disused silver mine when the ground starts shaking. Suddenly a sinkhole appears under Brewster, leaving him dangerously suspended on a section of track.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Shelley has brought little caterpillars to class and each pupil will take one home with them and care for it until it turns into a butterfly. But Paulie and Ben hope to speed up the process by feeding their caterpillars candy!! Charlie, on the other hand, has chosen to double the dose of blackberry leaves… who will be the first to have a butterfly?

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave go in search of the biggest number in Number Land. They learn that there is always a bigger number than any number they can think of.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When T’choupi and Nina find out there’s going to be a star shower visible in the sky tonight, they get very excited, and determined not to miss it! But they’re going to have to persuade their parents in order for that to happen… Not an easy feat: they’re way too young to stay up so late…

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Zari was talking to her mom on her phone as she walks down a lonely street lined with a lampposts. As she stops under a lamppost and the light begins to flicker, she slowly looks upwards to see a monster hanging from a lamppost. She skates away in fear, and remember her phone was there. She returns to the area and notice the so-called monster looks like a bat. Back in the garden, Leo is practicing with his jetpack maneuvering skill by performing spiral pattern and zig zag. He talks to Katie who is by her computer. After almost crashing into Hero the dog, Leo crash lands on the ground. Katie jokes on his skill before Leo receives a call from Zari. Zari informs them of the monster she met, which they later to learn it is a Greater Flying Fox. After agreeing to help Zari out, the Junior Rangers travels to her location. They meet up with Zari under the lamppost, where she show them of the animal. Hero tries barking at the animal but it ignores him. Katie has an idea and pulled her tablet to guide the flying fox away. Leo takes Katies tablet and fly with his jetpack to guide the Flying fox. As they were travelling, Katie notices Leos Jetpack is malfunctioning, causing Leo to have issues with flying and he crash land uncontrollably into a bush. They check up on him and Leo is okay.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The Ant Queen has just recovered from a long sickness, so the ants decide to build her a giant Ferris Wheel on top of the hill. The work isnt going as fast as theyve planned, so the forest friends decide to help them. The work still goes slowly, so they sadly give up, but then the night stars arrive to help the group, and the Ferris Wheel is finally complete.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The three bark beetles cant decide what costume to wear to the spring carnival party. So they ask the help of Leapy. Since she also still hasnt gotten a costume yet, they come up with the idea to dress as the four seasons. Leapy becomes Spring, and the three bark beetles become Summer, Fall and Winter. The four seasonelves go on to win the costume contest at the party.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In January, Eddy the Potato beetle and his friends visit Stanley, who presents his new toy cars. Eddy would like to try out the silver truck but accidentally breaks it. The next day, Eddy confesses his mistake and compensates Stanley with a golden-colored vehicle, while Patrik, the handyman beetle, repairs the wheel.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In February, the little friends gather for a carnival party and agree that there wont be a costume competition. Instead, the girls dress up as vegetables, while the boys dress up as fruits. However, Katie, the yellow ladybird and Snail Sam are not aware of this arrangement. So when they burst into Vendes house where the ball is taking place, everyone teams up to creatively transform their costumes. The friends enjoy the celebration, which is made complete by a large basket of colorful carnival donuts. On their way home, they admire the first snowdrops.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The five girls are getting ready for a spring welcoming party, where they will perform a spring dance. They share their plan with the mushrooms, who are thrilled and offer their hats. Rosita, the rose beetle promises to return them, but Berry puts the hats back incorrectly. Rosita puts them back in the correct order and, as an apology, the girls also present their dance to the mushrooms

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The bunnys friends gather for a cake party.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The series follows a pre-school bunny named Bing as he experiences the world around him. It uses small everyday occurrences to demonstrate how he learns new ways to manage situations with the help of his carer, Flop and friends. The programmes central phrase is "Its a Bing thing!" which Flop intones at the end of each episode when Bing has successfully conquered a troubling task or enjoyed a new childhood experience.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando are both tired but insist on one last game of Hide and Seek before bed. Pando finds a great hiding place under the covers of Bing’s bed but by the time Bing finds him he’s fast asleep. Bing is tired too and gets upset when he thinks there’s nowhere left for him to sleep, but Flop and Padget find a way.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula help Amma to get lunch ready. Bing watches yummy peas and delicious carrots go into the pot, but when lunch is served theyre all mixed up together and Bing doesnt like it.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing falls in love with a lost dog he and Flop find in the park and decides he wants to keep her. When the owner turns up Bing is very upset when it comes to saying goodbye to his new friend.

programme.title: Bing Bunny - Shorts and characters
programme.desc: Get to know our little pets better through charming stories featuring the characters from the popular Bing series.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon is Lou’s best friend, until one day when he realizes that Ferdinand is also Lou’s best friend. Simon is jealous but as soon as Ferdinand realizes that Lou has lice, he no longer wants to play with her. Simon on the other hand, couldn’t care less about lice! That’s what being a best friend is all about! And he invents a game so that everyone will want to play with Lou. And sure enough, at the end, she gives Simon a big kiss: YIPPEE!!!!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Edmond lives happily with his three little badger cubs in their underground sett. One day, he falls in love with Marguerite, a fox! Marguerite and her daughter move into the family home, turning life upside-down for everyone, who now needs to find a new way to live together in harmony.Directed by: Florian Ferrier (France, 2018)

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: You Summer in the meadow is a great time to find tasty snacks to eat. Big Nutbrown Hare seems to know all the best tricks and hiding spots for the yummy treats and Little Nutbrown Hare can’t help but wish he was as big and smart as his father. However, he soon finds out that there are some things a little Nutbrown Hare can teach a Big Nutbrown Hare.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On Summer’s hottest night Little Nutbrown Hare finds it hard to sleep. When a swim in the river isn’t enough to cool him down, Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends ask Little White Owl to tell them a really cold and sleepy bedtime story. Will she come up with a story that can make them feel cool and finally get Little Nutbrown Hare off to sleep?

programme.title: Boribon
programme.desc: Annalee is mysteriously preparing for a celebration, but she doesnt tell Boribon why. When Boribon asks, she simply says its a secret. Boribon gets upset at first, but he soon cheers up when the mystery is finally revealed.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: The magic show that Dr. Spotty was about to perform tonight is cancelled. Julia is so disappointed that Sam decides to invent something instead. But how could he impress Julia as much as a magician?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Grandma offers Sam and Julia a curious calendar representing the Mouse Mansion, each numbered window revealing an apartment the way it was long ago when its inhabitant first arrived.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets are watching a detective series on television before going to bed and they are fascinated by Sherlocks knack for solving enigmas. So when Poet cannot find his cuddly bear the next morning he decides to conduct an investigation. The kids search the entire apartment for evidence, with their magnifying glass, but in vain. They go to the bakery, then to the park and ask passersby for their help but still not a trace of the bear. It is finally Toto and his great sense of smell that will lead them to the cuddly toy, which was simply bundled up in Poets blanket.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets are thrilled: Eliott is coming over to babysit them tonight and they want him to tell them a scary story. But as the story goes along the kids are more and more frightened and prefer going to bed without hearing the end. How can they avoid nightmares? How about setting a net around their beds, using a magic cuddly bear or invoking a protective fairy? Suddenly they hear a loud noise in the apartment! Phew, it is only mom. The Triplets are really glad she is home.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Chuggington, follows the humorous adventures of Koko, Wilson and Brewster, three trainee engines as they learn to ride the rails of life and explore Chuggington, a safe and exciting world.Brewster has his first chuggineer test: he has to lay some track for the new high-­‐ speed tunnel link. But he’s forgotten to bring the right crane! Meanwhile, Wilson is the Chug Patroller on duty while Tyne and Fletch demolish an old bridge. The demolition throws up a lot of dust, making it difficult to see. Wilson has an idea! Using CP3, the Jetsprayer, he sprays water into the air and settles the dust. Brewster is inspired by this – he’ll think on his wheels like Wilson!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Its the Pontypandy Animal Parade at Annies Farm, and Peter and Norman want to join in by rounding Lambikins and Woolly.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: For Norman’s new webcast, Hannah and Norman try to get Joe to do silly things on camera, but they’re foiled by Miss Pawdry every time!

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Tiger wants to show everyone how good he is at crazy golf. He’s a bit upset when Kipper manages to get the ball through the Windmill – and he doesn’t – but he’s even more upset when his ball ends up in the pond and even Arnold manages the Loop the Loop.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper is confused when he finds himself having a conversation with an echo. Pig seems to know something about it. Then Jake gets involved and the ‘echo’ turns out to be a chatty bird called Henry.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: When Caillou loses his dinosaur toy, Rexy, he first panics, but then he imagines he’s a film noir detective trying to find his missing magnifying glass with his partner, Teddy. By staying calm and retracing Teddy’s steps, they find the magnifying glass and Caillou uses the same strategy to find Rexy.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: While playing bubbles with Grandpa, Caillou tries to teach Rosie how to blow bubbles properly, but she would rather do things her own way. Frustrated, Caillou pretends to be the Silver Knight training to be a wizard and discovers that there’s more than one way to cast a spell.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Kenji hears that he must travel home to Japan alone, he gets scared and tries to hide. So, Thomas sets out to find him.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Junior Ranger Zari is on a forest patrol in the Malaysian Forest when she later discovers an adorable Asian baby elephant. She contacts her fellow Junior Rangers Leo and Katie to ask for some help. Back in the garden, Leo and Katie were filling up an inflatable pool with water. They were interrupted when Leo receives a call from Zari, asking help on the baby elephant. After learning more about Asian elephants through Katies tablet and realize that the baby elephant must have been separated from its herd, they set off on a mission to reunite the baby elephant with its mother. When the Junior Ranger arrives, they see that baby elephant was cheerful beside Zari. Katie pulls up her tablet to see the closest river when they can go to meet the mother. After a while, the baby elephant sees a mud puddle and happily runs and lies in it. Then Ranger Rocky appears as he was nearby, introducing himself. The baby elephant sees Ranger Rocky and playfully cuddle from the baby elephant as it approaches him. Unable to free Ranger Rocky from the elephants weight, they come up with a clever plan using a branch as a snack to lure the baby elephant away.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In the dense Borneo forest, Farah faces a daunting challenge as she attempts to conquer a fallen tree trunk. With determination and strength, she overcomes the obstacle, celebrating a fleeting triumph. However, her moment of victory quickly transforms into an unexpected stumble when a mischievous tree root thwarts her progress, sending her crashing to the ground. As Farah lifts her head, her gaze is met with a sight that stirs her empathy—a distressed animal in need of assistance. Filled with concern, she extends her hand to aid the creature, only to be met with a sharp snap, forcing her to retreat. Meanwhile, in a different setting, Leo and Katie cautiously approach their canine companion, Hero, who is blissfully engrossed in chewing his bone. Intriguingly, they inform Hero of a promised reward, but with a peculiar condition—he must don a blindfold. Intrigued and trusting, Hero agrees, and Leo skillfully secures the blindfold around his loyal friend, while Katie lifts him up. Together, they embark on an adventure that leads them to a bathtub filled with frothy bubbles, aiming to fulfill the enigmatic reward. However, a slight misstep by Leo, unintentionally triggering a rubber duckie, shatters their stealthy approach, alerting Hero to the unusual situation. In an instant, Hero darts away, prompting the Junior Rangers to pursue him relentlessly. Amidst the commotion, Leos phone rings, and he answers to find Farah on the line, urgently requesting their help with a distressed turtle.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat is asked to deliver a huge block of ice to Michael for the Chinese summer festival.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat delivers a precious Indian elephant to Meera for her school show and tell.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are finally ready to leave for their picnic just as it starts to rain.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula invent a noisy game with a helium balloon they find stuck in a tree.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco discovers Bing’s dressing up box so they both dress up. Coco is Princess Cococapono and Bing is, of course, King Bing. But there is only one crown and both need it to complete their outfits. When the crown gets broken Flop helps them to make new crowns out of the broken pieces.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing makes Sula a picture with all her favourite things on it. It just needs one last jewel stuck on but oops the glue spills all over the picture. Sparkles save the day.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula, Pando, Flop and Padget all have a knack, something special they can all do and Bing gets frustrated when his own knacks are easy for everyone else to do.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald inadvertently makes a date to watch TV with Henry at the same time that hes supposed to go swimming with Daisy. He tries to do both without telling his friends. But as he runs back and forth, he gets more and more mixed up, with hilarious results. Finally, he confesses the truth, and they decide to combine both activities so that they can all be together.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald goes out to get some cocoa and a newspaper for Henry, who has a bad case of the Arctic Sniffles. On the way, Oswald encounters his friends, who all prescribe different cures – soup, warm clothes, and cough drops. Oswald winds up laden down with the various remedies, and gets caught in a rainstorm as he staggers back home. By then Henry is feeling better, and Oswald is the one with the sniffles!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Leo is late as he’s overslept thanks to staying up late playing a fishing game on his phone. Bob, Lofty, Leo and Wendy are installing a satellite dish and at the Spring City News HQ located at the docks. The dish has to be in place in time for the Six O’Clock News bulletin. En route to site the team stop to say hello to the Spring City Rockets who are practicing in preparation for a dance show later that day which will be covered on the news. On site Leo and Lofty are teamed up. During the build Leo is distracted by the game; Lofty suggests he should pay more attention. While tying the dish to Lofty’s hook Leo - distracted by the game - does not secure it properly. As Lofty raises the dish it comes loose and drops to the floor.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: After a solar panel demonstration, Mayor Madison decrees that the Sea Life Center will be entirely powered by renewable energy. Bob and the team must build a wind farm, which excites Scoop - he cant wait to see the spinny things going round. As they begin construction, Mr Bentley arrives and pulls Bob away, enthusing about other renewable energy schemes they have planned. Spring City will need more energy as it grows, so they need to think ahead. Scoop decides he should think ahead like Mr Bentley suggests, and convinces Lofty to move some of the turbines closer together.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Big Nutbrown Hare teaches Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends to play hide-and-seek, but the boisterous little hare finds it hard to stay still and quiet, especially when the Spring meadow is full of birds, butterflies and lizards to chase. When he does manage to stay still and quiet he finds the creatures of the meadow come to him… even very shy ones.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare finds a very special feather with bright colours, spots and soft tickly bits. Just as he shows off to his friends how it can fly and float, a cheeky bird flies away with it. Little Grey Squirrel climbs her tree and discovers the bird using it to feather her nest. Will Little Nutbrown Hare find a way to get his feather back, or will he decide that the bird needs it more than he does?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Spring morning a cute spotty ladybird lands on Little Nutbrown Hare and seems to want to stay with him. All his friends admire the interesting little creature and he feels very special indeed. When she eventually flies away Little Nutbrown Hare follows her, wanting her back. But he understands why she left when he discovers she has lots of tiny spotty babies.

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Timmy and Yabba are doing a puppet show for the class. But there is a surprise puppet in the show. Who is it?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The new yellow t-shirt that Sally planned on wearing for her portrait painting has mysteriously turned green. Huckle and Lowly help Sally look for clues as to how this colour-change happened. They discover that mixing different colours results in the creation of a new one. It turns out that the dye from a blue blanket turned the yellow shirt green in the washing machine. / The kids discover pieces of a large metal hand, Huckle and gang are determined to find out to whom they belong.

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: After a button pressing accident at the Fab Food Factory, a giant popcorn is on the loose in Okido. Will Messy and Zoom be able to stop it before it flattens the city?

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Messy borrows Zoes umbrella and it gets swept away by the rain. Messy and his friends go on a white water adventure down the drain in search for it!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: A blockage somewhere in the sparkleberry juice system that powers Berry Bitty City results in a repair crew of Berrykins invading the town with jackhammers. The girls leave for the day to avoid the noise and not get in the workers’ way. Trying to make the best of the situation, Strawberry gets an idea for the girls to have fun by holding their own berry bitty relay race—passing the baton from a sailboat race on the lake, to a steeple chase on frogs, to a sky race on birds.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry takes his blue and red robots into Dino World so that he can continue the battle they were having at home, but without Nanas scorn.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: After watching a movie about the life of a Cleopatra, the gang go to Dino World to make Patsy Queen.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A young California Sea Lion makes a surprise appearance during Leo’s basketball game. Later, a voyage to find the sea lion’s home turns into a daring rescue on the high seas.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Snow comes early to the Island of Sodor – and it is heavier than usual! Donald and Douglas are coupled back-to-back with a van between their tenders and snowploughs on their fronts. Donald and Douglas keep squabbling about which line they should clear first, culminating in a big argument. Donald pulls away hard, snapping a damaged coupling and moving away with Douglas’s tender! So Douglas is left behind in the snow – without coal or water! The time apart helps cool the brothers’ tempers. They are delighted to be reunited in the end – and share water and coal from their tenders. Brothers!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: James likes to show off and be the centre of attention, but when he doesn’t get his own way, he sulks and pouts. One day James is showing off so much that the passengers start complaining so the Fat Controller takes his coaches away. James starts to pout and he is still pouting the next morning. He is so sulky and rude that the Fat Controller leaves him in his shed. Eventually James apologises and the Fat Controller gives him some work to do, but when James discovers that he’s pulling waste trucks he starts sulking again and it is only when his friends help him laugh at himself that James finally manages to find a way to dowhat he has to do, and even enjoy it!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: During an expedition to the jungle, Smeraldo finds an ancient vase from the dragons’ age. Since he needs help to carry the relic to his lab, Grisu will join him in the mission. The job isn’t easy, as the vase is very frail and a bunch of wild animals - especially some cheeky toucans - will get in their way. But with the help of Smeraldo, Olivia and Stella (who sneaked onboard to take part in the adventure), Grisu manages to carry the precious object to a safe place.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: A shooting star has been seen above Dragontown. At it fell in the surrondings, Pr. Smeraldo wants to find it before the wind and the rain bury the stone. Unfortunately, he has a wide area to comb. Its a perfect mission for Grisu and Stella. Equiped with a metal detector, Grisu has to deal with many obstacles, among them Thingy who turns mad every time he hears the detector beeping. And you cant imagine how many metal things lie around. Not only cant Grisu and Stella find the precious meteorite, but also they collect metal waste such as an old whistle, a magnet, wire or a weathervane.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare discovers Little Field Mouse has a wonderful collection of interesting Autumn leaves and Little Grey Squirrel has a collection of acorns of all varieties, he decides to start a collection of his own. But Little Nutbrown Hare cant decide what to collect, until his father encourages him to realise that he has a wonderful collection of memories.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare And Little Field Mouse are surprised to find an egg lying on the ground. Blue Bird agrees to look after it and when a rather odd and demanding bird hatches, she loves it like her own. When Little White Owl hears it calling one night, she tells them all that the ‘lucky chick’ is a baby owl and she will teach her all an owl needs to know.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: The sure way of stopping the arguments between Rosie and Scoutbadger is that Rosie’s parents get back together… at least that is what she will try and arrange…

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob, Leo, Muck and Scoop are at Fixham Castle to clear a courtyard wall and restore a bricked-up archway to its original splendour. Leo is taken by a statue of Sir Roger de Fixham riding a horse in the courtyard and Muck and Scoop play charging knights. After the wall is cleared they hear a strange beeping noise. It turns out to be Mr. Bentley who is searching for buried treasure with his metal detector. Bentley tells them The Legend of the Silver Shield – a shield that the knight on the statue originally held but which was later buried somewhere in the castle grounds. Scoop is transfixed! While Bob and the others knock out the bricks from the Archway, Scoop decides to dig around for buried treasure.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob tells a tired Scoop to stay behind at Bobs Yard as he goes to build an ice-cream kiosk at the beach. Scoop keeps finding spurious reasons to radio Bob and make him return to the yard. Finally there’s a real crisis but Bob doesnt believe its anything serious. Scoop takes a burning bin to the beach where it falls on the kiosk roof. Scoop saves the kiosk by scooping sand onto the roof.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Forgetful Mayor Fox has misplaced the giant key to the city that hes supposed to be presenting to a visiting astronaut. Huckle and his pals try to figure out where he set it down. They learn that Mayor Fox did one thing while touring a candy factory that required both his hands - stirring a huge pot of candy goo. Not far away they find a big chocolate-covered key./When Busytown residents are baffled by mysterious door knocking, Huckle and gang discover who it is.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: When a Sunda slow loris lands in the garden, the Junior Rangers quickly learn that they have to return it to the wild. Will they manage to find the slow loris a home? Or will the slow loris end up as a snack for a hungry sun bear?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Join the Junior Rangers as they race across the tundra to reunite a lost reindeer calf with its herd. However, a river crossing might prove too tiring for the young reindeer.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and his little brother Gaspard want to play with Daddy in the yard but he keeps disappearing in the weirdest ways. Daddy suggests they play hide and seek but instead of looking for them, he disappears again. He suggests they play soccer, but he kicks the ball over the fence and into the neighbor’s yard. Mommy comes home from the office. Daddy suggests they hurry inside for their snack. What in the world is Daddy up to anyway?? Simon finally understands: if Daddy wants them occupied elsewhere, it’s because he preparing a super surprise for them! And he is! He’s built them a tree house! Thank-you Daddy!!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Dolly goes for a walk, and finally she is enriched with a beautiful cherry and a good friend.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry becomes sad because he can not climb on the rainbow but Dolly makes him happy with an exceptionally creative present.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry the snailboy and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They’re having many pretty adventures in 3X13 short tales, while they make new friends and get knowledges about the world around them.

A variety of other characters join them in their fun and games throughout the series with the stories set in their forest home. All the characters’ houses, belongings and clothes perfectly match their individual appearance.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
